item.title: Get Process List with Command Line Arguments
item.author: Rob Fuller
item.description: One of the most useful things when doing post exploitation on Linux is grabbing a full process list. One of the reasons this is useful is because it includes the arguments passed to these processes. The arguments for a process can tell you where configs are, what passwords might have been used or just tell you the correct arguments to use when running the process yourself. 1 2 3 user 281741 76190 2 14:18 pts/14 00:02:34 java -Xmx3733m -XX:+UseG1GC -jar /usr/share/zaproxy/zap-2.
